info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 5:42AM MST until December 13 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PLAINS BLIZZARD TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT... .A strong winter storm system will produce blizzard conditions over northeastern Colorado today through tonight. Strong winds are expected to gust up to 60 mph. The heaviest snow is expected to be on the plains east of Greeley and Denver, focusing toward the Akron, Sterling, Fort Morgan and Limon areas. If you are planning travel northeast, east or southeast of Denver today, you should consider changing your plans to avoid travel. Travel will be difficult to impossible and road closures are likely. Those with outdoor livestock interests should prepare now for blizzard conditions. Continued cold and very windy weather will continue behind the storm Wednesday into Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Fort Collins, Denver, Castle Rock, and Greeley. * WHEN...Until 3 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility to a quarter mile or less. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.
